;经过当地活动人士和世界名人长达数年的运动，当局周五宣布结束印度尼西亚苏拉威西岛臭名昭著的动物市场上“残酷”的猫狗肉屠宰活动。

;

;根据反虐待动物组织国际人道协会的说法，托莫洪极限市场将成为印度尼西亚第一个禁止猫狗肉的市场，或恒指。狗和猫在活着的时候被棍棒和火炬的图像引发了愤怒。

;

;托莫洪市市长卡罗尔·森杜克于周五宣布永久结束屠宰和贸易。 HSI 表示，他们将从屠宰场供应商手中救出所有剩余的活狗和猫，并将它们带到庇护所。

;

;托莫洪极限市场此前曾被宣传为旅游景点，并在 TripAdvisor 上列为还出售猫肉以及野生和受保护物种（如蝙蝠、蛇和其他爬行动物）尸体的目的地。

;

;还有心情吃蝙蝠吗？在这个极端的市场上，它出现在菜单上

;

;HSI 和以“印尼无狗肉”名义运作的印尼团体正在开展运动，以结束供人类食用的活狗交易，因为狂犬病可能在屠宰或接触受感染的肉类过程中传播给人类。

;

;活动人士 2018 年在北苏拉威西省的两个市场拍摄的视频显示，当工作人员将嚎叫的动物拉出来并用棍棒殴打它们的头时，狗蜷缩在笼子里。木警棍。这些动物通常还在移动，然后就会被喷灯吹掉毛发，准备屠宰和出售。

;

;福利组织称市场上动物的待遇“极其残忍”，就像“走过地狱”，引起了印度尼西亚人和世界各地的同情。

;

;国际演员和名人在 2018 年呼吁总统佐科·维多多关闭市场，称如果印度尼西亚加入其他已经禁止贸易的亚洲国家行列，那将“彻底结束”。信中列出的 90 多位名人包括女演员卡梅隆·迪亚兹、脱口秀主持人艾伦·德杰尼勒斯、才艺明星西蒙·考威尔、喜剧演员瑞奇·热维斯、印度尼西亚流行歌手安古和音乐家莫比。

;

;“这些动物，其中许多是被盗的宠物，遭受着粗暴和残酷的捕获、运输和屠宰方法，它们必须承受巨大的痛苦和恐惧。这封信称，狗肉不是食物，因此当地政府应采取行动禁止这种贸易。

;

;北苏拉威西省有超过 260 万人，他们在这个以穆斯林为主的群岛国家中主要是基督徒。

;

;据反虐待动物组织称，北苏拉威西省每周有数千只狗和猫被屠宰。

;

; >;

;农场主攻击韩国第一夫人试图“结束”吃狗肉

;

;中爪哇省的卡兰安雅区于 2019 年成为第一个发布正式禁令的地区，其他地区随后于 2020 年和 2021 年发布了正式禁令。最近，印度尼西亚首都雅加达当局于 3 月宣布，他们已禁止狗肉和猫肉交易。但狗和猫的市场在苏拉威西岛。

;

;印度尼西亚是世界上人口最多的穆斯林国家，似乎不太可能成为狗肉美食的中心，因为该国 2.7 亿人口中近 90% 是伊斯兰教信徒，伊斯兰教认为狗产品是非法的，或被禁止的，就像猪肉一样。大多数穆斯林不会碰狗，更不用说吃狗了。

;

;但这个群岛国家也是许多其他信仰的发源地，其中一些人认为狗肉是传统美食或认为它具有健康功效。

;

;根据“无狗肉印度尼西亚”的数据，多达 7% 的印度尼西亚人吃狗肉，主要集中在北苏拉威西省、北苏门答腊省和东努沙登加拉省，这些省份的人口大多数是基督徒

;

;许多国家据 HSI 称，菲律宾、台湾、新加坡、香港、泰国和马来西亚等亚洲地区已经禁止狗肉贸易和狗的消费。

;美国中央情报局局长威廉·伯恩斯周四表示，根据他所审查的情报，他对乌克兰将能够在对俄罗斯的反攻方面取得进展仍然持乐观态度。

;

;伯恩斯在科罗拉多州阿斯彭安全论坛上表示，俄罗斯在其建立的大量防御措施背后存在一些重大“结构性弱点”。这些弱点包括士气低落、指挥能力差以及政治和军事领导层的“混乱”。

;

;“这将是一项艰难的任务，但作为情报机构，我们将尽一切努力提供情报支持和共享，帮助乌克兰取得进展。”伯恩斯说。

;

;乌克兰威胁俄罗斯船只，让莫斯科想起莫斯科号沉没

;

;伯恩斯说雇佣兵领袖叶夫根尼·普里戈任六月的叛变“暴露了俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京建立的体系中的一些重大弱点。”

;

;“对于许多观看此剧的俄罗斯人来说，他们已经习惯了普京作为秩序仲裁者的形象，问题是皇帝是否没有穿衣服，或者至少为什么他需要这么长时间才能穿好衣服，”伯恩斯说。

;

;伯恩斯的评论呼应了本周早些时候爵士的言论理查德·摩尔（Richard Moore），英国秘密情报局局长，在军情六处出名。摩尔表示，普京政府受到“唯利是图、内讧和冷酷无能”的困扰，普里戈任叛变的后果让普京感到“羞辱”。

;

;伯恩斯说，普京可能会尽力避免给人留下他对叛变反应过度的印象，同时试图从普里戈任的瓦格纳网络中榨取他能得到的有价值的东西。不过，伯恩斯表示，普里戈任可能会在某个时候遭到普京的报复。

;

;“普京是报复的终极倡导者，”伯恩斯说。 “如果我是普里戈任，我就不会解雇我的食品品尝师。”

;

;伯恩斯说，这次叛变为中央情报局在俄罗斯招募人员提供了“千载难逢的机会”。

;

;该机构最近在 Telegram（俄罗斯开发并广泛使用的社交媒体和消息网站）上发布了第一篇视频，让俄罗斯人知道如何在“暗网”上联系该机构。伯恩斯表示，该视频发布后一周内浏览量达到 250 万次。

;

;伯恩斯在成为中央情报局局长之前是一名外交官，已成为拜登政府处理与俄罗斯和中国的棘手关系的关键秘密渠道。在俄罗斯入侵乌克兰之前，他曾前往莫斯科，试图说服普京政府不要发动攻击，最近又前往北京，以保持与中国的情报渠道畅通。

;

;伯恩斯表示，在中国遭遇挫折后，中央情报局在中国重建情报网络方面“取得了进展”。

;

;“我们已经取得了进展，近年来我们正在非常努力地工作，以确保我们拥有强大的人力情报能力，以补充我们通过其他方法可以做的事情，”伯恩斯

;

;华裔美国人对台湾的好感度高于中国：皮尤调查

;

;中央情报局于 2021 年成立了中国任务中心，以加强该机构对“日益敌对的中国政府”的关注。

;

;伯恩斯补充说，中国国家主席习近平及其军事领导层可能“怀疑他们是否能够以他们可以接受的成本成功地全面入侵台湾，”伯恩斯说。他说，普京在乌克兰的经历“可能加剧了其中一些疑虑”。

;人们越来越担心，随着该项目问题不断增多，大肆宣传的 2025 年日本大阪世博会最终会成为一场失败的哑火。

;

;在巴黎撤回金融候选资格后，大阪击败了阿塞拜疆城市巴库和俄罗斯叶卡捷琳堡，赢得了 2018 年 11 月的举办权。原因。在“为我们的生活设计未来社会”的口号下，活动组织者估计总成本为 1,250 亿日元（8.963 亿美元）。

;

;很快发现这个数字不切实际，并在 2020 年底增加了近 50% 至 1,850 亿日元。考虑到疫情的影响以及乌克兰冲突的持续影响，包括燃料和建筑材料价格的大幅上涨，一旦最终账目完成，这一数字也可能会黯然失色。

;

;Oozie the Doozie？诡异君？ Japan jeers at 'monstrous' World Expo mascot

;

;Residents of the Kansai region say they fear they will be left with the financial aftermath, just as Tokyo taxpayers were left to cover a large part of the bill when the Tokyo Olympic Games went well beyond its initial budget.

;

;“The people of Osaka are pretty shrewd and they are thoroughly fed-up with this entire project,” said Noriko Hama, a professor of economics at Doshisha University in nearby Kyoto. “我看到越来越多的人要求得到关于成本以及这一切将对他们产生的影响的答案。

;

;“最重要的是，我们不知道为什么这座城市迫切希望举办世博会，因为有一些更好的方式来花掉所有这些钱，”她说。

;

;由于生活成本下降，维多利亚州取消英联邦运动会在澳大利亚受到欢呼

;

;成本大幅超支只是问题的一部分，然而，对于一个这样的活动来说将于 2025 年 4 月 13 日开始为期六个月的运行，组织者自信地预测将吸引 2800 万游客。

;

;此次活动选定的地点是大阪湾的人造岛梦岛，需要延长该市的一条地铁线。由于材料成本飙升、疫情造成的延误以及劳动力短缺，基础设施项目的建设进度落后于计划。

;

;更复杂的是，计划在同一个占地 390 公顷的人工岛上的另一部分建设一座综合度假村，内设赌场、高端酒店、会议设施以及零售和餐厅。在世博会已经缺乏建筑物资和人力的情况下，这个庞大的工程只会加剧建筑物资和人力的竞争，而道路通行受限将不可避免地造成拥堵。

;

;迄今为止，已有153个国家和地区报名参加为期184天的世博会，但距离开幕式还有不到两年的时间，大阪市政府尚未收到德国、瑞士等主要国家表示打算自行建造的50个展馆的详细施工文件。

;

;根据主办方的时间表，展馆建设预计于2024年7月完成，内部装修预计于2025年1月完成。目前看来，按时完成的可能性越来越小。

;

;其余展馆将由世博会主办方建造，其中一些将在地区之间共享，但同样的材料和人力短缺问题预计将造成更多瓶颈。

;

;7月《朝日新闻》在 1 月 4 日的社论中要​​求对该项目进行审查，以确定原计划是否“过于乐观”，并指出最初的成本估算“只是基于过去类似项目的成本”，并没有试图考虑该项目可能面临的任何障碍。

;

;该报还表示，当地政府“不应简单地增加公众的经济负担”，居民们衷心同意这一立场。

;

;同志社大学的 Hama 表示，世博会的概念是“不合时宜的”，这一概念可以追溯到 1889 年在巴黎举办的第一次世博会。

;

;“当时各国可能需要宣传自己，但这不是我们今天生活的世界，”她说。 “这些事件已经没有了灵魂和精神，它们只不过成为腐败和少数企业致富的机会。”

;在丑闻交织在一起的情况下，澳大利亚今年最尴尬的时刻可能只会为公民减轻一些经济痛苦，同时发现更多证据来反对明显的任人唯亲和贪婪的公司。

;

;不举办运动会意味着州政府将跳过目前规模大得多的 6-70 亿澳元（4-48 亿美元）账单，但将从该账单中节省的约 30 亿澳元用于住房和设施。初始成本为 26 亿澳元。

;

;虽然不多，但当维多利亚州的债务以及澳大利亚所有私人和公共债务飙升时，这一点就很重要。

;

;澳大利亚表示，由于“有针对性”的救助计划不会加剧通货膨胀

;

;奇怪的是，在与维多利亚州州长丹尼尔·安德鲁斯及其团队举行的新闻发布会上，很少有人询问通货膨胀对该决定的影响，特别是，建筑成本上升。大多数询问都与他们的数字和政治失误有关。

;

;如今，涉及住房、建筑物和体育场馆的建筑预算大幅膨胀已是司空见惯。

;

;在澳大利亚各地，由于通货膨胀和供应链中断，建筑商都对原材料成本不断飙升表示遗憾。曾经出现过建筑商因成本上涨而无法履行固定合同而倒闭的情况。

;

;房屋建筑商表示，他们最好只是闲置在建筑工地上，而私人贷款机构则表示，开发商因现金耗尽而乞求融资。

;

;当住房供应放缓时，不难发现问题。

;

;你只需要看看平均 20 澳元（13.60 美元）的外卖就知道一切成本都在上涨，尽管通货膨胀率——目前为 7%——开始下降。

;

;这件事已经变成了一场政治足球。维多利亚州政府被指责将澳大利亚变成了国际笑柄，一些评论家和政敌呼吁安德鲁斯辞职。

;那些支持安德鲁斯的人也在社交媒体上表示，他们认为搁置“过时的殖民主义哗众取宠”没有什么问题。 A total of 54 countries and 18 territories previously colonised by the British Empire can compete.

;

;Athletes who have trained hard for the event, of course, might disagree.

;

;Victoria's axing of Commonwealth Games cheered in Australia as living costs bite

;

;In the background is the fact that one of the “external consultants” that had estimated the initial costs of the 2026 games was Big Four accounting firm EY that – along with its peers, KPMG, Deloitte and PwC – has been under fire in Australia.

;

;They are under scrutiny for alleged corruption, conflicts of interests – auditing companies while charging them for consulting – and scheming off billions of dollars in government contracts.

;

;PwC, at the heart of the scandal, has been accused of financial treason by leaking confidential Australian tax briefings to benefit its clients and plump up its top line.

;

;A parliamentary inquiry triggered by the PwC scandal is now scrutinising all “consulting” firms, including global management consulting giants McKinsey and Boston Consulting Group.

;

;Earlier this week, the inquiry saw Big Four CEOs defend pay cheques of up to A$3.5 million a year, as senators grilled them over the lack of salary transparency in their firms despite a significant portion of their revenues coming from taxpayers.

;

;Australia urged to cut ties with Big Four firms as PwC scandal widens

;

;Former KPMG partner-turned-whistle-blower Brendan Lyon outlined how his fellow partners held secret meetings to conceal his findings that the New South Wales state transport department's accounts were misstated by billions of dollars. KPMG denied many of these claims.

;

;The Commonwealth Games snafu has shone more light on the Big Four scandal. The upshot is potentially more savings for Australians as governments wind back further their cosy relationships with consulting firms.

;

;We are now talking more than the A$4 billion saved from Victoria's cancelling its hosting duties.

;

;It's a win-win and win.

;The story of a Hong Kong woman who was tricked by her superstitious mother-in-law into drinking the ashes of burned Taoist script to help her “make a baby” has caused outrage online.

;

;The woman, who goes by the name @Waiyiuyiu, complained about her mother-in-law on a local online forum on July 5.

;

;She said her husband's mother, with whom she had never got along, cooked soup for her when her husband was on a business trip in Macau.

;

;After finishing the soup, the woman discovered a “strange residue” in the bowl. Unfamiliar with soup making so she didn't think much of it and offered to wash the dishes.

;

;While in the kitchen she overheard her mother-in-law on the phone explaining to someone that the residue was fu shui, or charmed water, made from mixing with the ashes of a burned Taoist talisman, that she had secretly put in the soup to make her produce a baby.

;

;Taoist talismen are strips of paper containing written symbols which are said to muster benevolent spiritual energies to purify, heal the sick and drive away demons. When made soluble, they are also known to create “magic water”.

;

;The woman's husband later told her that his mother had asked him to “do the business” with her on his return from Macau so that “the magic would work” and produce a baby.

;

;The poster said she and her husband had explained many times why they did not want a baby, but the mother-in-law refused to listen.

;

;She added that she was shocked by the old woman's ignorance and cheekiness and would refuse to see her for at least a year.

;

;Fu shui is said to have originated in China in the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220) when a leader of the Yellow Turban Rebellion peasant revolt and follower of Taoism, Zhang Jue, gave out such water which is believed to have cured impoverished people and attracted a large army.

;

;Some people still believe in the powers of the water to this day.

;

;In recent years, an increasing number of reports have revealed that the ink used to write the script is poisonous.

;

;The mother-in-law's superstitious and sneaky act sparked outrage on the forum.

;

;“The magic water will do the opposite of the desired effect,” said one online observer.

;

;“You should never eat anything she makes again,” another person warned the poster.

;

;“Why did she not feed her son with the magic water? Sometimes not conceiving is the man's problem,” commented a third.

;

;Superstitious remedies to aid conception, however, remain popular in China.

;

;Some people go to the temples to pray to deities such as the Gold Flower Goddess and the Child-giving Goddess of Mercy.

;

;In 2016, a woman from southeastern China attempted to have a baby by changing her household feng shui and sticking a red talisman onto the bed. However, she only ended up irritating her husband.

;Disgraced former top securities regulator Liu Shiyu has been appointed as an adviser to the central bank's head office in an unusual comeback for a Chinese cadre under a corruption cloud.

;

;In recent months Liu has attended meetings in Chongqing as well as Jiangsu and Hubei provinces in his new role with the People's Bank of China, according to online posts by local government bodies and official associations since April.

;

;The 61-year-old's new job was first reported by Guangdong-based financial publication China Fund News on July 8.

;

;It comes four years after Liu was punished and demoted for “wrongdoings” following an investigation by the anti-corruption watchdog. But Liu, who headed the China Securities Regulatory Commission, did not face criminal charges and was not expelled from the ruling Communist Party.

;

;He is now working for the Counsellors' Office of the PBOC – a unit within its head office that handles currency and foreign debt data, conducts research on legal, economic and financial matters, and makes recommendations to the central bank management. It has no decision-making power.

;

;Liu was chairman of the powerful CSRC for three years before he was sidelined to the role of deputy party chief of the All-China Federation of Supply and Marketing Cooperatives in January 2019, a move that shocked the financial sector.

;

;Four months later, Beijing said Liu had surrendered himself to the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection.

;

;After a five-month investigation the watchdog found Liu had not upheld the principles of a party member, made inappropriate public speeches and lacked “political vigilance” and awareness of confidentiality rules. He was also found to have used his public role for personal gain, broke the rules to get jobs or promotions for others, and accepted gifts to make it easier for his relatives to buy homes.

;

;But Liu was given a relatively light punishment – he was removed from his post at the state-run federation and put on two years' probation within the party, meaning he could retain his membership. He was demoted to the job of a researcher and his illegal income was confiscated.

;

;The anti-graft agency said Liu had received lenient treatment because of his “good attitude towards admitting wrongdoing”.

;

;Liu is known as the securities regulator who dealt with the aftermath of the 2015 stock market crash that wiped out US$5 trillion in mainland China. He took the helm of the CSRC in early 2016, replacing Xiao Gang who had stepped down after introducing a circuit-breaker mechanism that spooked the market then abandoned it days later.

;

;Like many senior officials, Liu has publicly pledged his loyalty to President Xi Jinping, and in 2017 he lauded Xi for “saving” the party, saying he had foiled a coup plot by former political heavyweights.

;

;China's crackdown on high-flying bankers sends jitters across brokerage industry

;

;Professor Xie Maosong, a senior fellow with the Taihe Institute, a think tank in Beijing, said Liu's new role suggested the party was willing to give cadres with needed experience and industry knowledge a second chance if their wrongdoings were seen as minor.

;

;“The key here is that Liu's case was not very serious and he turned himself in. He managed to keep his party membership and is still considered a comrade,” said Xie, who is also a senior researcher at Tsinghua University's National Institute of Strategic Studies.

;

;“The PBOC's Counsellors' Office is a good match for Liu Shiyu's professional ability and work experience,” he added.
